intro: Sopubia buchneri, commonly known as the Buchner's spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually clustered in a structure called a cyathium. Sopubia buchneri is characterized by its hairy stems and alternate leaves with a distinctive shape.
